main_text.sentence: The high levels of serum S100A8/A9 in chronic inflammatory pathologies such as rheumatoid arthritis and inflammatory bowel disease, as well as during bronchitis and tuberculosis [20], suggest that they might play a role in inflammatory reactions.

Tissue infiltration by leukocytes is a common hallmark in several chronic inflammatory states which include the inflammatory bowel diseases, ulcerative colitis (UC), and Crohn's disease (CD), but also several other chronic inflammatory states such as arthritis, lupus, diabetes [17,47,58].
Atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory disease [27,28].
Another inflammatory mediator, nitric oxide (NO), has been linked to a number of physiologic processes, including leukocyte-dependent inflammatory processes and oxidant-mediated tissue injury [8,9].

Emerging evidence suggests that pro-inflammatory genotypes are related to unsuccessful ageing, and, reciprocally, controlling inflammatory status may allow a better chance of successful ageing [4,5,8,12].

source_text.title: Myeloid-related proteins 8 and 14 are specifically secreted during interaction of phagocytes and activated endothelium and are useful markers for monitoring disease activity in pauciarticular-onset juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
